name: Acarology
value: the study of ticks and mites

name: Actinobiology
value: the study of the effects of radiation upon living organisms

name: Actinology
value: the study of the effect of light on chemicals

name: Aerobiology
value: a branch of biology that studies organic particles transported by the air

name: Aetiology
value: the study of the causes of disease

name: Agrobiology
value: the study of plant nutrition and growth related to soil

name: Agrology
value: the branch of soil science dealing with production of crops

name: Algology
value: the study of algae; the study of pain

name: Allergology
value: the study of the causes and treatment of allergies

name: Anesthesiology
value: the study of anesthesia and anesthetics

name: Angiology
value: the study of the anatomy of blood and lymph vascular systems

name: Archaeozoology
value: the study of relationships between humans and animals over time

name: Astrobiology
value: the study of origin of life

name: Astrogeology
value: the study of geology of celestial bodies

name: Autecology
value: the study of the ecology of individual species

name: Bioecology
value: the study of interaction of life in the environment

name: Cariology
value: the study of cells; the study of dental cavities

name: Cetology
value: the study of cetaceans (e.g., whales, dolphins)

name: Conchology
value: the study of shells and of mollusks

name: Coniology
value: the study of dust in the atmosphere and its effects on living organisms

name: Craniology
value: the study of the characteristics of the skull

name: Cryology
value: the study of very low temperatures and related phenomena

name: Cytomorphology
value: the study of the structure of cells

name: Cytopathology
value: the branch of pathology that studies diseases on the cellular level

name: Dendrochronology
value: the study of the age of trees and the records in their rings

name: Dermatopathology
value: the field of dermatological anatomical pathology

name: Ecohydrology
value: the study of interactions between organisms and the water cycle

name: Ecology
value: the study of the relationships between living organisms and their environment

name: Ecophysiology
value: the study of the interrelationship between an organisms physical functioning and its environment

name: Edaphology
value: a branch of soil science that studies the influence of soil on life

name: Electrophysiology
value: the study of the relationship between electric phenomena and bodily processes

name: Endocrinology
value: the study of internal secretory glands

name: Epidemiology
value: the study of the origin and spread of diseases

name: Exobiology
value: the study of life in outer space

name: Exogeology
value: the study of geology of celestial bodies

name: Gastrology (gastroenterology)
value: the study of the stomach and intestines

name: Geobiology
value: the study of the biosphere and its relations to the lithosphere and atmosphere

name: Geochronology
value: the study of the age of the Earth

name: Gynecology
value: the study of medicine relating to women

name: Helioseismology
value: the study of vibrations and oscillations in the sun

name: Herbology
value: the study of the therapeutic use of plants

name: Herpetology
value: the study of reptiles and amphibians

name: Histopathology
value: the study of the microscopic structure of diseased tissue

name: Ichnology
value: the study of fossil footprints, tracks, and burrows

name: Immunology
value: the study of the immune system

name: Karyology
value: the study of karyotypes (a branch of cytology)

name: Kinesiology
value: the study of movement in relation to human anatomy

name: Kymatology
value: the study of waves or wave motions

name: Lepidopterology
value: the study of butterflies and moths

name: Lymphology
value: the study of the lymph system and glands

name: Micrology
value: the science of preparing and handling microscopic objects

name: Nanotechnology
value: the study of machines at the molecular level

name: Nanotribology
value: the study of friction on the molecular and atomic scale

name: Neurophysiology
value: the study of the functions of the nervous system

name: Odonatology
value: the study of dragonflies and damselflies

name: Orology
value: the study of mountains and their mapping

name: Orthopterology
value: the study of grasshoppers and crickets

name: Otolaryngology
value: the study of the ear and throat

name: Otorhinolaryngology
value: the study of the ear, nose, and throat

name: Paleoanthropology
value: the study of prehistoric people and human origins

name: Paleoecology
value: the study of prehistoric environments by analyzing fossils and rock strata

name: Paleontology
value: the study of fossils of ancient life

name: Paleophytology
value: the study of ancient multicellular plants

name: Parapsychology
value: the study of paranormal or psychic phenomena that defy conventional scientific explanations

name: Petrology
value: the studyv of rocks and conditions by which they form

name: Phenology
value: the study of periodic biological phenomena

name: Phlebology
value: a branch of medicine that deals with the venous system

name: Physiology
value: the study of the functions of living organisms

name: Phytosociology
value: the study of the ecology of plant communities

name: Planetology
value: the study of planets and solar systems

name: Proctology
value: the study of the rectum, anus, colon, and pelvic floor

name: Psychobiology
value: the study and psychology of organisms with regard to their functions and structures

name: Psychology
value: the study of mental processes in living creatures

name: Psychopathology
value: the study of mental illness or disorders

name: Psychopharmacology
value: the study of psychotropic or psychiatric drugs

name: Psychophysiology
value: the study of the physiological bases of psychological processes

name: Pulmonology
value: the study of diseases of the lungs and the respiratory tract

name: Radiology
value: the study of rays, usually ionizing radiation

name: Reflexology
value: originally the study of reflexes or of reflex responses

name: Sarcology
value: a subsection of anatomy that studies the soft tissues

name: Sedimentology
value: a branch of geology that studies sediments

name: Sociobiology
value: the study of the effect of evolution on ethology

name: Speleology
value: the study or exploration of caves

name: Technology
value: the study of the practical arts

name: Topology
value: the mathematical study of closeness and connectedness

name: Traumatology
value: the study of wounds and injuries

name: Tribology
value: the study of friction and lubrication

name: Trichology
value: the study of hair and scalp

name: Urology
value: the study of the urogenital tract

name: Zooarchaeology
value: the study of animal remains from archaeological sites to reconstruct relationships between people, animals, and their environment

name: Zoopsychology
value: the study of mental processes in animals
